hero.expertMentorshipDesc: Learn from Olympic medalists and renowned scientists
hero.comprehensiveTrainingDesc: Structured programs covering all science disciplines
hero.globalNetworkDesc: Connect with peers and mentors worldwide
hero.provenResultsDesc: Track record of international competition success

programs.title: Our Programs
programs.subtitle: Comprehensive training programs designed to prepare exceptional students for national and international science olympiads.

mathematics.description: Advanced mathematical problem solving and competition preparation

chemistry.title: Chemistry

chemistry.title: Chemistry
chemistry.description: Elite training program aligned with the International Chemistry Olympiad (IChO) standards, integrating theoretical mastery and practical laboratory work.
chemistry.overview: The Chemistry Program builds strong foundations in chemical theory, reaction mechanisms, and laboratory experimentation. Students solve IChO-level problems, conduct advanced experiments, and study analytical and synthetic chemistry techniques.

objectives.1: Develop deep understanding of chemical principles
objectives.2: Master reaction mechanisms and quantitative analysis
objectives.3: Apply thermodynamics, kinetics, and equilibrium in problem solving
objectives.4: Gain laboratory skills aligned with IChO practical requirements

prereqs.2: Ability to understand mathematical descriptions of chemical processes

chemistry.applicationNote: Open to students with outstanding chemistry talent and laboratory skills.
chemistry.curriculumDescription: A structured roadmap covering all essential domains in chemistry.

physics.title: Physics
physics.description: Master fundamental laws of nature through theoretical understanding and experimental discovery, with a focus on olympiad-level problem solving.
physics.overview: The Physics Program develops analytical reasoning through intensive theoretical training and experimental physics practice. Students explore classical and modern physics, applying mathematical methods and modeling techniques to solve olympiad-level problems.
physics.overviewExtra: Curriculum integrates conceptual understanding, experimental methods, and problem-solving strategies to prepare for national and international competitions.

objectives.1: Master theoretical and experimental physics concepts
objectives.2: Apply calculus-based reasoning to olympiad problems
objectives.3: Perform quantitative modeling and derive physical laws
objectives.4: Strengthen laboratory and experimental analysis skills
objectives.5: Develop contest strategies for multi-step physics problems

prereqs.1: Strong foundation in mathematics and basic physics
prereqs.2: Understanding of mechanics, thermodynamics, and electromagnetism
prereqs.3: High motivation for advanced scientific study

physics.applicationNote: Open to students with outstanding mathematical and physics talent.
physics.curriculumDescription: A structured roadmap covering all essential physics domains.

mathematics.title: Mathematics
mathematics.description: Advanced mathematical problem solving and competition preparation for the International Mathematical Olympiad and other prestigious competitions.
mathematics.overview: The Mathematics Program aims to cultivate deep mathematical thinking through systematic training, rigorous problem-solving practice, and exposure to international olympiad standards. Students engage in intensive coursework covering advanced mathematical theories and learn to apply them in non-standard, competition-level problem contexts.
mathematics.overviewExtra: The curriculum integrates conceptual understanding, creative problem-solving, mathematical proof techniques, competition strategies, and timed assessments. This approach ensures readiness for district, regional, national, and international olympiads.

objectives.2: Strengthen logical reasoning and proof-writing skills
objectives.3: Build effective contest strategies and time management skills
objectives.4: Enhance abstract thinking across algebra, geometry, number theory, and combinatorics
objectives.5: Prepare for high-performing participation in international mathematics competitions

prereqs.1: Strong foundation in secondary school mathematics
prereqs.2: Demonstrated interest in advanced mathematical problem solving
prereqs.3: High level of self-discipline and readiness for intensive training
prereqs.4: Successful completion of the Center's competitive entrance examination

mathematics.applicationNote: Open to students with outstanding mathematical talent and demonstrated analytical ability.
mathematics.curriculumDescription: A structured roadmap covering all essential olympiad domains in mathematics.

biology.title: Biology
biology.description: Comprehensive biological sciences training fully aligned with the International Biology Olympiad (IBO) standards.
biology.overview: This program cultivates advanced biological knowledge through conceptual lectures, laboratory modules, and olympiad-style problem solving. Students explore molecular, cellular, ecological, and evolutionary biology with emphasis on scientific reasoning.

objectives.1: Master core concepts of modern biology
objectives.2: Analyze biological systems at molecular and organismal levels
objectives.3: Develop experimental design and data interpretation skills
objectives.4: Apply scientific method to olympiad-level problems

prereqs.3: Readiness for intensive lab and theoretical training

biology.applicationNote: Open to students with strong biological knowledge and laboratory skills.
biology.curriculumDescription: A structured roadmap covering all essential domains in biology.

computerScience.title: Computer Science
computerScience.description: Advanced program for preparing students for the International Olympiad in Informatics (IOI) and competitive programming contests.
computerScience.overview: The Informatics Program trains students in algorithmic thinking, programming efficiency, and data structure mastery. The curriculum emphasizes solving complex computational problems under timed conditions.

objectives.2: Understand advanced algorithms and data structures
objectives.4: Master IOI-style problem solving and code optimization

prereqs.3: Ability to work on challenging logical tasks

computerScience.applicationNote: Open to students with strong programming and algorithmic skills.
computerScience.curriculumDescription: Structured roadmap covering essential computer science and competitive programming domains.

about.title: About
about.description: Learn about our mission, vision, and the team dedicated to nurturing scientific excellence in Uzbekistan.

mission.heroDescription: Our guiding principles and aspirations that drive everything we do at the Science Olympiad Center.
mission.missionSubtitle: The fundamental purpose that guides our daily operations and long-term strategy.
mission.talentDevelopmentDesc: To identify talented students, support them, and foster their interest in science through comprehensive training programs and mentorship opportunities.
mission.youthEmpowermentDesc: To create opportunities for Uzbek youth to showcase their knowledge and skills through science olympiads and international competitions.
mission.educationalExcellenceDesc: To effectively organize national and international competitions, contests, and projects that contribute to improving the quality of education.
mission.scientificAdvancementDesc: To strengthen the country's scientific potential and nurture future scientists who will drive innovation and discovery.
mission.visionSubtitle: The future we envision and are working tirelessly to achieve.
mission.globalRecognitionDesc: To position Uzbekistan among the leading countries in international science olympiads, establishing our nation as a powerhouse of scientific talent.
mission.innovationEcosystemDesc: To establish an innovative educational ecosystem where every talented student can fully realize their potential and contribute to scientific advancement.
mission.regionalLeadershipDesc: To become a leading regional center for supporting olympiad participants, serving as a model for other nations in Central Asia.
mission.futureScientistsDesc: To nurture a new generation with high intellectual capacity, capable of competing on a global scale and driving scientific innovation.
mission.ctaDescription: Whether you're a talented student, dedicated educator, or supportive parent, there's a place for you in our mission to advance scientific education in Uzbekistan.

general.title: General Information
general.subtitle: The Science Olympiad Center is a state educational institution under the Agency for Specialized Educational Institutions of the Ministry of Preschool and School Education of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
general.aboutCenterText1: The Science Olympiad Center is an educational and organizational institution established as a state organization under the Agency for Specialized Educational Institutions of the Ministry of Preschool and School Education.
general.aboutCenterText2: The Center operates based on the advanced initiatives of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan with the goal of identifying gifted students, developing their scientific potential, and preparing internationally competitive specialists.
general.aboutCenterText3: Its mission is to establish a system for early identification, development, and international preparation of talented students through science olympiads, competitions, and academic challenges under the guidance of qualified mentors.

apply.title: How to
apply.description: Join our elite training programs and start your journey towards international olympiad success.

olympiads.title: Science
olympiads.description: Explore various national and international science olympiad competitions.

programs.mainDescription: Comprehensive training programs designed to prepare exceptional students for national and international science olympiads.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our programs, application process, and admission requirements.

questions.whatIsCenter: What is the Science Olympiad Center?
questions.whatIsCenterAnswer: The Science Olympiad Center is Uzbekistan's premier institution for identifying, training, and supporting talented students in science competitions. We prepare students for national and international olympiads in mathematics, physics, chemistry, biology, and computer science.
questions.applicationDeadlineAnswer: The application deadline for 2025 programs is January 31, 2025. We recommend submitting your application early as spots are limited and filled on a competitive basis.
questions.programDuration: How long are the training programs?
questions.programDurationAnswer: Program duration varies by subject: Mathematics (6 months), Physics (8 months), Chemistry (7 months), Biology (9 months), and Computer Science (5 months). All programs include intensive training and competition preparation.
questions.applicationFeeAnswer: No, there is no application fee. Our programs are completely free for selected students, including training, materials, and competition participation.
questions.selectionProcessAnswer: Selection involves application review, subject-specific assessments, expert evaluation, and interviews. We consider academic performance (40%), problem-solving skills (30%), competition experience (20%), and motivation (10%).
questions.accommodationAnswer: Yes, we provide accommodation for students from outside Tashkent. Our residential facilities include dormitories, dining halls, study rooms, and recreational areas, all supervised by qualified staff.

hero.title: Local
hero.description: The Main Olympiad is conducted across 17 subjects in four progressive stages, from school level to republic level, providing a comprehensive pathway for academic excellence.

stagesSection.title: Olympiad Stages
stagesSection.description: Progress through four stages of competition, from school level to republic level, demonstrating your excellence in 17 subjects.

labels.eachProblemEvaluated: Each problem evaluated according to specific criteria
labels.problemsSolvedOnline: problems solved on an online portal
labels.pointsAwardedForCompleted: Points awarded for fully completed and system-accepted problems
labels.group2Summary: Languages, History, Geography, State and Law Fundamentals
labels.informaticsFormatDescription: Two days under same conditions (placing program solutions in electronic system)
labels.pointsAwardedBySystem: Points awarded by electronic system for fully completed and accepted problems
labels.languageSubjectsList: Native Language and Literature, Uzbek Language, Russian Language and Literature, Kazakh Language, Tajik Language, Karakalpak Language and Literature
labels.foreignLanguagesFormatDescription: Single round with two parts (listening comprehension, reading, and lexico-grammatical skills assessment)
labels.listeningReadingAssessment: Assessment of listening comprehension and reading abilities
labels.vocabGrammarAssessment: Test questions assessing vocabulary and grammar knowledge
labels.twoRoundsDescription: Two rounds: written work and test questions

1.name: School Stage
1.description: The first stage of the Main Olympiad, conducted among students of state and non-state general secondary education institutions, academic lyceums, and vocational schools across 17 subjects.
1.eligibility: Students in grades 9-11 of state and non-state general secondary education institutions, and students in stages 1-2 of academic lyceums and vocational education institutions.
1.format: Organized by educational institution pedagogical councils

requirements.0: Determining competition dates and ensuring student safety
requirements.1: Forming judging panels (3-7 members) for each subject
requirements.3: Preparing control materials and ensuring confidentiality
requirements.4: Submitting recommendations for winners to advance to the next stage

1.notification: All students must be informed at least 3 days before the competition through notice boards, social media, Telegram groups, teacher announcements, and general assemblies.
1.winners: Up to 3 winners per subject and grade level (1st, 2nd, 3rd places) are determined based on scores and recommended by the school pedagogical council to participate in the next stage.

2.name: District/City Stage
2.description: The second stage of the Main Olympiad, conducted among students of general secondary education institutions, non-state general secondary education institutions, and specialized schools under the Agency for Specialized Educational Institutions.
2.eligibility: Students in grades 9-11 of general secondary education institutions, non-state general secondary education institutions, and specialized schools (school-internats), as well as students in stages 1-2 of vocational education institutions.
2.format: Centralized test examinations in all subjects, conducted at locations determined by regional organizational committees
2.exceptions: Academic lyceums under various ministries, specialized schools (Presidential and Creative Schools, Al-Beruniy International School-Internat, Abu Ali ibn Sino, Mirzo Ulug'bek, Muhammad al-Khwarizmi specialized schools) and their regional branches participate directly in the third (regional) stage, skipping this stage.
2.specialRule: Students who won 1st place in grades 9-10 in the third (regional) stage of the previous academic year participate directly in the third (regional) stage of the current academic year.
2.winners: 3 winners per subject and grade level (1st, 2nd, 3rd places) are determined based on test results and recommended by the organizational committee to participate in the third stage.

3.name: Regional Stage
3.description: The third stage of the Main Olympiad, featuring more complex problem-solving and comprehensive evaluation across multiple subjects.
3.eligibility: Students who won 1st, 2nd, or 3rd place in the district/city stage in the relevant subject and grade, as well as up to 3 students recommended by specialized educational institutions, academic lyceums, and non-state educational institutions.
3.format: Two-part examinations for science subjects; single-part test examinations for humanities

part1.description: Problems of varying difficulty levels, each evaluated according to specific criteria

breakdown.simple: First 10 questions: Simple closed tests (A, B, C, D), 0.9 points each
breakdown.medium: Next 10 questions: Medium difficulty closed tests (A, B, C, D), 1.5 points each
breakdown.complex: Last 10 questions: Open tests (written answers), 2.6 points each

informatics.description: Problems of varying difficulty levels solved on an online portal. Points awarded for fully completed and system-accepted problems.

breakdown.simple: First 10 questions: Simple difficulty closed tests (A, B, C, D), 1.3 points each
breakdown.medium: Next 15 questions: Medium difficulty closed tests (A, B, C, D), 2.4 points each
breakdown.complex: Last 15 questions: High difficulty closed tests (A, B, C, D), 3.4 points each

3.winners: 3 winners per subject and grade level (1st, 2nd, 3rd places) are determined based on total scores and recommended by the judging panel and organizational committee to participate in the next stage.
3.prizes: Winners (1st, 2nd, 3rd places) in each subject are awarded one-time monetary prizes as specified in the Cabinet of Ministers Resolution No. 562 dated September 9, 2021.
3.republicQualifiers: 11th grade students with the highest achievements in each subject receive invitations to participate in the Republic Stage of the Main Olympiad.

4.name: Republic Stage
4.description: The final and most prestigious stage of the Main Olympiad, bringing together the best students from across Uzbekistan to compete at the national level.
4.eligibility: Students who won 1st, 2nd, or 3rd place in the third (regional) stage - specifically 11th grade students from general secondary education institutions, vocational schools, and academic lyceums.

prizes.benefits: Winners receive certificates that grant the right to admission to state higher education institutions without exams or with maximum points

part1.name: Listening comprehension and reading skills
part1.description: Assessment of listening and reading comprehension abilities

part2.name: Lexico-grammatical skills
part2.description: Assessment of vocabulary and grammar knowledge

informatics.format: Placing program solutions in electronic system
informatics.description: Participants solve problems by placing program solutions in an electronic system. Points are awarded by the electronic system for fully completed and accepted problems.

other.description: All other subjects are conducted in two rounds: written work and test questions

cta.title: Start Your Olympiad Journey
cta.description: Begin at the school stage and progress through district, regional, and republic levels. Each stage builds your skills and opens new opportunities for academic excellence.

successStories.title: Success Stories
successStories.description: Meet our prestigious olympiad winners who went on to achieve international recognition.

akmal.name: Akmal Karimov
akmal.title: Mathematics Gold Medalist
akmal.quote: Winning the National Mathematics Olympiad opened doors to IMO 2024 where I achieved a perfect score. Now studying at MIT with a full scholarship.

nilufar.name: Nilufar Rashidova
nilufar.title: Physics Gold Medalist
nilufar.quote: The rigorous training for National Physics Olympiad prepared me for IPhO success. Currently pursuing PhD in Theoretical Physics at Cambridge.

sardor.name: Sardor Abdullayev
sardor.title: Chemistry Gold Medalist
sardor.quote: National Chemistry Olympiad victory led to IChO gold medal and research opportunities. Now working on sustainable chemistry solutions at Stanford.
